alert.note: Alert for Southeast St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 7:52PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern St. Tammany Parish, southern Hancock and southwestern Pearl River Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 752 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bush, or 9 miles west of Picayune, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Picayune, Pearl River, Pearlington, Shoreline Park, Stennis Space Center, Kiln and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 262 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 13. Interstate 12 between mile markers 79 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.
